intro: Barnadesia coccinosantha, commonly known as the red-flowered barnadesia, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant red petals that contrast with its dark green, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a notable species in botanical studies.
